title: Ticket #2821: Manual pages did not contain backslash
description:
Manual pages of some condor tools did not properly display backslash, but online documentation is correct.

From http://research.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v7.6/condor_q.html:
%condor_q -submitter jdoe -format "%d." ClusterId -format "%d\n" ProcId
27.0

From man pages:
%condor_q -submitter jdoe -format "%d." ClusterId -format "%d0 ProcId
27.0

From http://research.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v7.6/condor_status.html:
% condor_status -constraint OpSys==\"LINUX\"
Note that quotation marks must be escaped with the backslash characters for most shells.

From man pages:
% condor_status -constraint OpSys==
Note that quotation marks must be escaped with the backslash characters for most shells.
remarks:

punting to karen for evaluation.

2012-Apr-06 11:21:34 by tstclair:
reviewed, no comments.
attachments:
• 0001-Fixed-backslash-generation-from-html-to-man-pages.patch 1185 bytes added by slebodnik on 2012-Feb-11 21:13:43 UTC.
    Backslash \ have to be escaped \\ to be displayed correctly in manual pages. This patch also add some test line to test html page.
check_ins: 2012-Apr-06 11:12   Check-in [31535]: #2821 Fixed backslash generation from html to man pages Committer: Timothy St. Clair (By Lukas Slebodnik )
